name: B. Wonderful Gloves
statement:
You are the proud owner of many colorful gloves, and you keep them in a
drawer. Each glove is in one of n colors numbered 1 to n. Specifically,
for each i from 1 to n, you have l_i left gloves and r_i right gloves
with color i.Unfortunately, it’s late at night, so . In other words, you
will only know the color and the type (left or right) of a glove you
take it out of the drawer.A matching pair of gloves with color i
consists of exactly one left glove and one right glove with color i.
Find the minimum number of gloves you need to take out of the drawer to
that you have k matching pairs of gloves with colors.Formally, find the
smallest positive integer x such that: For any set of x gloves you take
out of the drawer, there will always be at least k matching pairs of
gloves with different colors.
